properties.areaDesc: Laramie, WY; Goshen, WY; Albany, WY; Platte, WY
properties.headline: Snow Squall Warning issued February 8 at 5:12PM MST until February 8 at 6:00PM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Cheyenne has issued a

* Snow Squall Warning for...
Southeastern Albany County in southeastern Wyoming...
Southern Goshen County in southeastern Wyoming...
Northern Laramie County in southeastern Wyoming...
Southern Platte County in southeastern Wyoming...

* Until 600 PM MST.

* At 512 PM MST, a dangerous snow squall was located along a line
extending from 6 miles east of Slater to 6 miles north of Lake
Hattie Reservoir, moving southeast at 40 mph.

HAZARD...Whiteout conditions. Zero visibility in heavy snow and
blowing snow. Wind gusts up to 30 mph.

SOURCE...Radar and webcams.

IMPACT...Dangerous life-threatening travel.

*

This includes the following highways...
Interstate 25 in Wyoming between mile markers 18 and 62.
Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 293 and 343.

Locations impacted include...
Laramie, La Grange, Chugwater, Federal, Tie Siding, Pumpkin Vine,
Vedauwoo Campground, Hawk Springs, North Crow Campground, Iron
Mountain, Hawk Springs Campground, Granite Springs Campground, Horse
Creek, The Buttes, Yellow Pine Campground, Tie City Campground,
Vedauwoo, University Of Wyoming War Memorial Stadium, Crystal Lake
Reservoir and Crystal Lake Campground.
properties.instruction:
Reduce your speed and turn on headlights! During snow squalls, the
visibility may suddenly drop to near zero in whiteout conditions.

Serious injuries and deaths may result from people exiting their
vehicles during a snow squall. Drivers may not be able to see you or
to stop! If stopped on the roadway or involved in an accident,
quickly exit your vehicle move as far away from the roadway as
possible ONLY when it is safe to do so. Do not stand along or near
the roadway, since approaching vehicles may be unable to maintain
control.

CMAMtext: Snow Squall Warning til 6:00 PM MST. Sudden whiteouts. Icy roads. Slow down! -NWS
